Questions.Question: Which musician wrote the song 'Imagine'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Imagine' was written by John Lennon and released in 1971 as a powerful anthem for peace and unity.

Questions.Question: Which band performed the song 'Blowin' in the Wind'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Blowin' in the Wind' was performed by Bob Dylan and became an iconic protest song during the civil rights movement.

Questions.Question: Which musician sang 'What's Going On'?
Questions.Explanation: 'What's Going On' was sung by Marvin Gaye and released in 1971, addressing social and political issues of the time.

Questions.Question: Which band released the song 'Give Peace a Chance'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Give Peace a Chance' was released by The Plastic Ono Band, a group formed by John Lennon and Yoko Ono.

Questions.Question: Which musician wrote the song 'A Change is Gonna Come'?
Questions.Explanation: 'A Change is Gonna Come' was written and performed by Sam Cooke, becoming an anthem for the civil rights movement.

Questions.Question: Which band sang 'War'?
Questions.Explanation: 'War' was sung by U2 and released in 1983, highlighting the impact of war on society.

Questions.Question: Which musician wrote the song 'Redemption Song'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Redemption Song' was written and performed by Bob Marley, emphasizing freedom and emancipation.

Questions.Question: Which band released the song 'Sunday Bloody Sunday'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Sunday Bloody Sunday' was released by U2, addressing the Troubles in Northern Ireland.

Questions.Question: Which musician sang 'Strange Fruit'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Strange Fruit' was sung by Billie Holiday, shedding light on the horrors of racism and lynching.

Questions.Question: Which band performed the song 'Ohio'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Ohio' was performed by Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young, expressing outrage over the Kent State shootings.

Questions.Question: Which musician wrote the song 'Fight the Power'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Fight the Power' was written and performed by Public Enemy, advocating against oppression and racism.

Questions.Question: Which band released the song 'Zombie'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Zombie' was released by The Cranberries, addressing the Troubles in Northern Ireland.

Questions.Question: Which musician sang 'We Shall Overcome'?
Questions.Explanation: 'We Shall Overcome' was popularized by Pete Seeger, becoming an anthem for the civil rights movement.

Questions.Question: Which band performed the song 'Fortunate Son'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Fortunate Son' was performed by Creedence Clearwater Revival, criticizing the Vietnam War and social inequality.
